author: Devesh K
text:
The CBI on Tuesday filed a charge sheet against suspended Uttar Pradesh chief engineer Yadav Singh, his wife and six subordinates, along with three private firms and their functionaries, for awarding of contracts in lieu of bribes, causing a loss of Rs.19 crore to the exchequer.

Further investigation into the allotment of 1,280 projects worth Rs. 959 crore and other alleged instances of corruption during the tenure of the accused officials is under way.

Mr. Singh, the former chief engineer of Noida, Greater Noida and Yamuna Expressway authorities, was arrested last month. He took bribes through his wife Kusum Lata in the form of investments, the CBI said.
title: CBI files charges against Yadav Singh, 13 others
